intro: Macaranga magnistipulosa, commonly known as the large-leaf macaranga, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish or yellowish in color. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
